args: Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" . Capitol flags at full-staff — after a weather-related struggle Although flags around the country are flying at half-staff in honor of late former president Jimmy Carter, flags around the U.S. Capitol complex are flying at full-staff on Monday morning at the request of House Speaker Mike Johnson. But the winter weather did not make that task easy. Icy precipitation and freezing temperatures froze the flags’ cords, complicating staff members’ efforts to raise the flags, according to a person familiar with the process who spoke on the condition of anonymity to speak candidly. The staff was able to raise the flags eventually. Flags had been at half-staff, as is the tradition for 30 days after a president dies. But Johnson ordered the flags raised for Monday in honor of Donald Trump’s inauguration as president. Afterward, they will be lowered again for the rest of the mourning period.
